record.field: General Surgeon
General surgeons perform surgical procedures on various organs and bodily systems. They may have training in diseases of the organs such as the stomach, bowels, pancreas, liver, and gallbladder
Pulmonologist
Pulmonologists focus on the organs involved in breathing, including the lungs and heart
Obstetrician
Obstetricians specialize in treating reproductive organs and deal with pregnancy and childbirth
Neonatologist
Neonatologists are doctors who specialize in treating newborns and infants.
Pediatrician
Pediatricians specialize in treating older children.
Gynecologist
Gynecologists specialize in diseases of the female reproductive organs
Urologist
Urologists specialize in issues related to the urinary tract, including the kidneys, bladder, male reproductive organs, and adrenal glands
Gastroenterologist
Gastroenterologists specialize in digestive organs, including the stomach, bowels, pancreas, liver, and gallbladder
Nephrologist
Nephrologists treat kidney diseases and prescribe dialysis for those experiencing kidney failure.
Neurologist
Neurologists take care of patients with neurological conditions, which can affect various organs and bodily functions.
Endocrinologist
Endocrinologists treat disorders of the endocrine system, which includes glands that produce and secrete hormones that regulate the body's functions.
